resources.string: Select Dental+ to enable/disable permission

When you authorize the app to link with Apple Health, you allow Philips Dental+ to write data to and read data from Apple Health. The data exchanged includes your brushing duration. You can turn off sharing at any time.

Please select \"Allow all the time\" if you want the Dental+ app to be able to automatically collect brushing history when the app is closed and your phone is near your toothbrush. An up-to-date history improves the brushing tips Dental+ provides.
Periodontal areas
To connect to your toothbrush and provide personalized tips, Dental+ needs to access nearby devices.
Dental+ never tracks your geographic location.
Bluetooth permission for the Dental+ app has been disabled
Your progress

When you consent to receiving brushing guidance you allow Philips Dental+ to improve your oral health. We do so by keeping track of your progress and goals and providing personalized advice. The oral care information we process includes your brushing patterns, goals, oral care habits, focus areas, and any personalization responses you provide, which are associated to your account.

When you consent to receiving brushing guidance, you allow Philips Dental+ to improve your oral health. We do so by keeping track of your progress and goals and providing personalized advice. The oral care information we process includes your brushing patterns, goals, oral care habits (such as flossing and rinsing), and your answers in our Personalization page and Focus Area (such as plaque build-up, bleeding areas, gum recession and potential cavities), which we associate to your account.
Brush twice a day
Brush until your toothbrush stops
The toothbrush you connected is not supported by the Dental+ app.
Connect to a new device
Simply go to your phone settings and allow Bluetooth for Dental+. When you are all set, return to the app to continue so we can connect to your toothbrush.
Here\'s how to do that: • Go to your phone settings • Open Bluetooth • Tap on Philips Sonicare and choose \'Forget\' or \'Unpair\' • Return to the Dental+ app and accept the pairing request

Here's how to do that:

• Go to your phone settings
• Open Bluetooth
• Tap on the info icon, and select ‘Forget This Device’ for Philips Sonicare
• Return to the Dental+ app and accept the pairing request

Here's how to do that:

• Place the toothbrush on its original charger
• Press and release the power button 10 times within 5 seconds while toothbrush remains on the charger
• When all the lights turn on in rapid succession, the reset is complete
• Return to the Dental+ app and accept the pairing request

When you connect your toothbrush to the Dental+ App (“App”), Philips (“Philips”, “we” or “us”) provides its own services to you and processes your personal data in accordance with the App’s Privacy Notice. You may also instruct Philips to share your personal data with other third parties for purposes outside the services Philips provides – and we understand that you would like us to do so for purposes of the BrushSmart Program. Therefore, by tapping on “Agree and continue” you are instructing and authorizing Philips to share the following data with Delta Dental for purposes of the BrushSmart Program:
You will need to allow access to your location settings, so that the Dental+ app can automatically receive your brushing info when your phone and toothbrush are nearby.
The brush head reordering service will automatically be cancelled if you deregister your toothbrush from your Dental+ app account.
Dental+ app monitors your brush head usage, and orders are made for you.
You\'re on a roll! See how far you\'ve come.
Please update to continue enjoying the latest features of the Dental+ app.
I allow Philips Dental+ access to my brushing data, to ensure I receive the most from my Sonicare complete oral healthcare experience.
Customize your Privacy settings. Read the Philips Dental+ Privacy Policy for more information

This allows your toothbrush to automatically connect to the app when near your device. Keeping your brushing history up-to-date improves the tips Dental+ provides for you.

When you consent to receiving brushing guidance and making the app better, you allow Philips Dental+ to improve your oral health. We do so by keeping track of your progress and goals, providing personalized advice, and developing new features and solutions for you. The oral care information we process includes your brushing patterns, goals, oral care habits (such as flossing and rinsing), and your answers in our Personalization page and Focus Area (such as plaque build-up, bleeding areas, gum recession and potential cavities), which we associate to your account.
I have read and accept the Dental+ app %s
Sorry no Coverage data available. Please use the Dental+ app when brushing to get the coverage applied mouth map report.
Sorry no Pressure data available. Please use the Dental+ app when brushing to get the Pressure applied mouth map report
Sorry no Scrubbing data available. Please use the Dental+ app when brushing to get the Scrubbing applied mouth map report

At first glance it may not be obvious, but brush heads lose stiffness and gradually wear down over months of use. Our blue reminder bristles fade to white and help you recognize when it\'s time for a replacement. For optimal results use the Brush Head Performance Monitor in our Philips Dental+ app to track when to replace your brush head.
Open the Dental+ app to see your progress this week!
